intro: Sherardia, commonly known as the yellow wood or African yellowwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. The plants are characterized by their woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Sherardia species are also known for their ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making them adaptable to various ecological niches.
